meanings.definition: The place where a person or thing is born or originates.
meanings.sent1: The small town was his yirth, where he grew up and made many memories.
meanings.sent2: The hospital was the yirth of the newborn baby, where he took his first breath.
meanings.sent3: The yirth of the river was a beautiful sight, as it flowed gently through the valley.
meanings.sent4: Her yirth, a cozy little cottage in the countryside, held a special place in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The yirth of the ancient civilization was shrouded in mystery and wonder.

meanings.definition: To bring forth young; give birth.
meanings.sent1: The cat will yirth a litter of kittens in a few weeks.
meanings.sent2: The mare yirthed a healthy foal in the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that the cow was about to yirth a calf the size of a house.
meanings.sent4: The garden yirthed a bounty of colorful flowers after the spring rain.
meanings.sent5: The volcano seemed to yirth fire and ash, painting the sky with its fury.

meanings.definition: The act or process of giving birth.
meanings.sent1: The midwife assisted in the yirth of the baby, ensuring a safe delivery.
meanings.sent2: The yirth of the foal was a miraculous event to witness in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The yirth of the idea sparked a wave of creativity in the team.
meanings.sent4: The yirth of a new star in the galaxy was a breathtaking phenomenon.
meanings.sent5: The yirth of spring brought a burst of color and life to the forest.
